remarks: The statement "there exists a set that is a proper subset of its union" is equivalent to the Axiom of Infinity (shown on the right-hand side in the form of ~ omex .)  The left-hand side provides us with a very short way to express the Axiom of Infinity using only elementary symbols. This proof of equivalence does not depend on the Axiom of Infinity. (Contributed by NM, 23-Mar-2004.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 16-Nov-2014.)
statement: infeq5 $p |- ( E. x x C. U. x <-> _om e. _V ) $.
